page.title: 20LAND RECLAMATION SCHEMES
page.content: The Groundwork Trust and Manpower Services have been very active in improving local areas. {A NATURE WALK ALONG MOSTON BROOK The river has been cleared of rubbish and new footpaths made. Trees and bushes have been planted but there are many kinds of wild flowers like Scentless Mayweed,Shepherd's Purse, Ragwort and Hemlock. Insects like mayfly, red admirals and orange tips were flying round. The steps to the valley were made from railway sleepers from Moston sidings which are not used any more. Close to the sidings at the end of Muirfield close is a patch of wild orchids. At Kaskenmoor School, the S.W. edge of the school grounds have been designated as a {CONSERVATION}area. Many species of trees, shrubs etc. have been planted.
